data.title: Pizza and pudding!
data.text:
I am from NY originally so I am a tough critic for pizza. This was one of the best pizzas I have had. We had the round pizza (not the thick crust) plain cheese. The sauce was great and the pizza was not greasy.  They also had a local western NY beer on tap! 
The wait staff were friendly and attentive. Our waiter suggested the chocolate pudding. We share one dish among the three of us and it was delish!  A very pleasant unexpected meal off the beaten path. If you are in to whimsical decor be sure to hit the head while you are there.

data.title: Outstanding Detroit style 'Za
data.text: What a great discovery Rosalee's has been. I've made multiple tr I ps for the fantastic high quality square deep dish Detroit style pizza. Delicious. The staff is always very friendly and the place has a real locals, hometown feel. Excellent craft beer selection and bar service also. Highly recommend for a casual dining experience in Longmont.

data.title: great freshly made pizza
data.text:
At Rosalee's Pizzaria you can be sure of a welcoming atmosphere, friendly staff and very attentive owners. The food is always very good, even though I have heard that the wait can be somewhat long. I have to tell you, if you want to eat a fresh handmade excellent pizza, then accept the fact that it may take a tad bit longer. This is not "Boboli" :-)
Engage in a conversation with your neighbor at the bar or at the community table. Or just relax and enjoy any of the several live music events at Rosalee's
I like going there often because I have never been dissappointed

data.title: Great pizza...fun atmosphere
data.text:
Love eating lunch at Rosalee's...one very large slice of pizza, a small salad and a beer!

The pizza crust is thin (which I like) and the toppings are great.  Fun environment where you feel most welcome.  It is frequented by neighbors from Old Town.

data.title: Great pizza. Great setting.
data.text: We stopped for a pizza, garlic knots, and a few drinks. Fun for the family. Pizza crust was nice and light.

data.title: Primo pizza
data.text: This place specializes in pizza and they do it right. The thin crust pizza is perfect; just slightly chewy and crunchy.  The toppings are simple and the best quality.  The round easily feeds three or at lunchtime you can order single slices. The square is wonderful, thick, chewy and just enough crunchy crust. They also have a selection of local beers. Try Vindication,  a Boulder favorite.

data.title: Best Pizza in Denver Area
data.text: Rosalee's never disappoints. Amy and James, the owners, like the rest of their staff, are warm, courteous, unfailingly generous and treat their customers like members of the family. Everything about Rosalee's is superb. Even if their pizza was average or mediocre, which it is not, my wife and I would patronize them because they are just so nice and care so much about doing right by their customers. It is the best in the entire area.

data.title: Fresh, house-made ingredients make delicious pie!
data.text: The pizza here is hands down the best in Longmont, if not Boulder county. The service is personal and done with a smile. Everyone who greeted me in the restaurant was great. Home-made ingredients create a unique pie like no other you will find. Limited menu is due to these specialized ingredients and original combinations. Completely worth the visit!

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Sausage garlic knots are amazing. The sausage is homemade. I wish they would sell it for me to take home.

data.title: Amazing pizza and Sausage knots
data.text: I had lunch here and found the pepperoni pizza to be unusual with a nice red sauce and a flaky light crust.  The peperoni was not excessively spicy which I prefer.  I also had Sausage Knots on the recommendation of the wait staff person who is the Mother in law of the Owner and Mother of the other Owner.  They sausage is made from pork right on site and is very good. The sausage was moderately spicy.  The knot had the same flaky type crust as the pizza.  The spice did not linger long on the palate so I would get sausage knots again.   I will go to this restaurant again.

data.title: Amazing Pizza Served Up Friendly
data.text: In one word...yum. This pizza is too good, however, to stop there. I was hooked on my first bite. If you like fresh, here you go. If you like friendly service doubled with a fun and rustic atmosphere, here you go. This is a very popular place to hang out, so if you go at a busy time, just kick back and enjoy yourself. I'd recommend a meal at Rosalee's during off hours. These folks have mastered a good crust on their pizza, and have fresh takes on traditional ingredients, as well as new topping combos to die for. I really love the atmosphere here, a sucker for the old time brick walls, high ceilings and hardwood floors in many of the shops and restaurants along Main Street Longmont.

data.title: Wishing it was the best, highly dissapointed ...
data.text: Unfortunately, I read the fabulous reviews and could almost taste the pizza I have been searching for, feel it my duty to at least express three diners disappointment in the establishment. It was also a special occasion, knowing it was a casual pizzeria was not expecting much on atmosphere, but it was noisy, not with fellow diners (2) but the staff, we were there mid afternoon on a Friday, perhaps they were busy preparing for the rush but sadly poor attention to our table. I knew in advance there is not a full bar, found the beer and wine offered was extremely limited.The pizza it self was not good enough to make me give this as second chance.

data.title: Incredible Pizza in Longmont!
data.text: We have frequented this pizza joint over the past summer and have been overjoyed to find pizza that tastes as good as New York's and with a really nice atmosphere. We have only tried a few things on the menu, but keep coming back to the margarita pizza. It is definitely busy and hard to get a table at times, but they offer community tables and have patio space when the weather is nice. They serve square and round pizzas, and are well know for their garlic and sausage knots, although we didn't try those, they sure smelled good! They have a few arcade games for kids, and it can be a bit noisy, but we have tried other pizza places in town and nothing compares.

data.title: Good pizza. Bad Management.
data.text:
In the five times I have eaten at Rosalee's only twice has the service been acceptable. The first time we experienced a very long wait for our pizza. Only after asking our server why everyone else seated after us has already been served and we were still waiting did we learn ours was dropped on the floor and they were making us another one. There were no attempts made to make up for the wait.

On another visit we received a cold pizza. No explanations or apologies. 

Last but not least, our last experience has been the worst. Our party of four arrived at 6 :15 when we were told it would be about a 30 minute wait. Not a problem until that turned into more like an hour and twenty. Once we were seated it took another hour to get our pizza and again when we asked why it was taking so long we were given a few excuses, no attempts at compensating us with an appetizer or drinks. When we got our bill we were being charged for four extra drinks we did not order. The bill of course, was corrected.

The pizza is good but as one person in our party expressed, it's not good enough to make it worth the poor service we received. 

The restaurant is small and gets crowded on certain days, however they have been in business a few years now, pizza is all they make, mostly thin crust. There shouldn't be any surprises in the kitchen. We spent almost three hours waiting for one thin crust pizza. I think the worst of it is the oh well, too bad attitude from the staff.

data.title: Awesome pie...great atmosphere...
data.text: ...and the best people!  Amy is great.  We love having pie there.  My wife and I have been afforded the opportunity to dine at the finest places and the most obscure, this one is our all time favorite for pizza.  Look out Pizzeria Bianco!

data.title: Love the Pizza and atmosphere!
data.text: Rosalee's serve's New York style pizza plus a few other items.  I love their thin but chewy crust, the simple tomato sauce, and the perfect amount of cheese on top. Also, they make their own sausage which is just right...flavorful, but not too salty.  Plus a simple but effective local beer list.

data.title: Authentic Pizza, Great Service
data.text: Our family of four visited here after reading reviews on trip advisor during our stay in Longmont. Pizza was delicious and my boys loved it. We sat out on homey back patio and had fun and energetic waiters! Definitely a place to go!

data.title: Great Pizza, beer and atmospere
data.text: After a long day in Rocky Mountain National Park, our family was looking for a good local pizza before heading back to our campsite in Longmont. We found it here at Rosalee's!! We ordered the square ( pizza is either by round thin or square thick) with just the homemade sausage. The square takes about 40 min to cook but it was worth the wait! Crust just crispy enough, fresh sauce and homemade sausage....all six of us loved it! Good local craft beer selection. Atmosphere was cool and the servers very friendly. Definitely recommend if in the area.

data.title: Great vibe, great pie
data.text:
My partner being a New Yorker, I've listened to a litany of pizza critiques for the past fifteen years. At last, there was silence at a pizza restaurant when we ate at Rosalee's on a recent Wednesday.

The live music was great and the food was even better. Since my partner got busy sucking down pie and garlic knots- without a single complaint, I got to enjoy the busy village pizza joint atmosphere and a couple of excellent slices. The crust is "just right" - not oversalted, not doughy, crisp, the perfect balance between chew and bite-through. The tomato sauce taste fresh and real and leaves plenty of room for every other flavor.

We've been back a couple of times and picked up a pie to take home - absolutely consistent in quality and awesomeness each time! Also tried the sausage knots - a MUST have!!

Yay - finally - New York pizza in Longmont.  Get there!!!

data.title: As advertised
data.text: Went based on the reviews and I couldn't be more impressed. The guest service was great, with food to match!! Will be back!
